title: Update roadmap for onboarding & analytics
description: Update the Q1 roadmap to reflect onboarding as the top priority and push the advanced analytics pilot to March.
evidence: Jeffy: So onboarding is urgent and impactful. Analytics is important but less urgent. Mira, please update the roadmap to reflect that, and push analytics pilot to March? Mira: Yep, I'll shift timelines.

title: Define 3 onboarding success KPIs
description: Define 3 concrete Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure onboarding success within 30 days.
evidence: Jeffy: Also, Mira, I want 3 concrete KPIs to measure onboarding success within 30 days. Can you do that by tomorrow morning? Mira: Uh, yeah, that's doable. I'll have something by then.

title: Plan lightweight onboarding usability test
description: Plan a quick, lightweight usability test, consisting of a maximum of two sessions, after the new onboarding prototype is ready.
deadline: After new onboarding prototype is ready
evidence: Leah: Should we plan a quick usability test after the new onboarding prototype is ready? Nothing big, like two sessions max? Jeffy: Sounds good. Keep it lightweight.

title: Complete backend changes for onboarding
description: Engineering team to complete the backend changes required for the onboarding flow.
evidence: Arun: Engineering can do backend changes this week and UI next week. We're aiming for a Thursday internal demo.

title: Complete UI changes for onboarding
description: Engineering team to complete the UI changes required for the onboarding flow.
evidence: Arun: Engineering can do backend changes this week and UI next week. We're aiming for a Thursday internal demo.

title: Keep internal messaging consistent about silent launch
description: Ensure consistent internal messaging regarding the silent launch of the onboarding update, with no external ads or blog posts.
evidence: Jeffy: Silent. No ads or blog posts. Leah: I'll keep messaging consistent.

title: Deliver design assets to engineering
description: Deliver the necessary design assets to Arun's engineering team.
evidence: Arun: Waiting on design assets tonight. Leah: You'll have them by 8 PM.

title: Plan A/B test for deferred permissions
description: Plan an A/B test for the onboarding permission screen, specifically testing deferring some permissions to a later stage to reduce friction.
evidence: Mira: That could reduce friction. Should we test that variant? Jeffy: Yes, put that in as an A/B test post-launch.

title: Design explanatory microcopy/tooltips for permission screen
description: Work on designing explanatory microcopy or short tooltips to clarify why certain permissions are needed upfront on the onboarding screen.
evidence: Jeffy: Sounds good, Daniel. Can you work on that? Daniel: Will do.

title: Record usability testing sessions
description: Ensure that all usability testing sessions are recorded for detailed analysis.
evidence: Jeffy: Excellent. Make sure to record sessions for analysis.

title: Draft internal messaging about analytics pilot delay
description: Draft messaging for internal teams, such as marketing, to manage expectations regarding the delay of the analytics pilot to March.
evidence: Jeffy: We need to manage expectations. Leah, please help draft messaging to internal teams. Leah: On it.

title: Fix data pipeline bugs for analytics
description: Use the extra time gained from delaying the analytics pilot to improve data accuracy and fix existing data pipeline bugs for the analytics backend.
evidence: Arun: About analytics backend, if we delay pilot, can we use this time to improve data accuracy? Jeffy: Absolutely. Use the extra time to fix data pipeline bugs.

title: Prepare a roadmap update deck
description: Prepare a concise presentation deck outlining the key changes and dates for the updated roadmap.
evidence: Mira: For the roadmap update, do you want a formal doc or just a quick deck? Jeffy: Deck with key changes and dates. Keep it tight.

title: Prepare to field questions for Thursday demo
description: Prepare to answer potential questions from the team during the internal demo of the core onboarding flow.
evidence: Mira: Will product be ready to field questions? Jeffy: Yes, Mira, you should be prepped.

title: Prepare user feedback snippets for demo
description: Prepare quick user feedback snippets to present during the internal onboarding demo.
evidence: Leah: I can prepare quick user feedback snippets for the demo. Jeffy: Perfect.

title: Invite Customer Success to onboarding demo
description: Invite the Customer Success team to attend the internal demo of the core onboarding flow.
evidence: Leah: Should we invite customer success team? Jeffy: Yeah, good idea.

title: Conduct smoke tests for onboarding
description: The QA team is to conduct smoke tests for the new onboarding flow.
evidence: Arun: QA is prepping test cases for onboarding. Will do smoke tests by Wednesday.

title: Finish final design icons
description: Complete the design of the final icons required for the onboarding project.
evidence: Arun: Design asset delay, but Daniel is on it. Daniel: Yep, finishing final icons today.

title: Review final design icons
description: Review the final design icons completed by Daniel.
evidence: Leah: I'll review those tomorrow morning.

title: Add qualitative feedback to post-onboarding survey
description: Incorporate qualitative feedback, such as an 'ease of use' rating, into the post-onboarding survey.
evidence: Mira: For KPIs, we might want to add qualitative feedback, like “ease of use” rating. Jeffy: Good call. Leah: We'll add that to post-onboarding survey.

title: Push for design intern hire
description: Advocate and push forward the initiative to hire a design intern to help alleviate resource constraints.
evidence: Jeffy: Can we get an intern in design? Mira: I’ll push for it.

title: Expedite design intern hiring process
description: Work to speed up the process for hiring a design intern.
evidence: Jeffy: Cool, please speed that up.

title: Build onboarding as modular pieces
description: Engineer the onboarding flow using modular components to facilitate easier future iterations and avoid extensive rewrites.
evidence: Jeffy: Worth it. Build modular to avoid rewrites later. Mira: Got it.

title: Design clearer error messages
description: Design clearer and more user-friendly error messages for the onboarding process, based on user feedback.
evidence: Jeffy: Definitely a must. Daniel: Will work on error message designs next week.

title: Send weekly email updates to Marketing on onboarding progress
description: Provide weekly email updates to the Marketing team regarding the progress of the onboarding project.
evidence: Mira: Marketing still wants early heads-up on onboarding progress. Jeffy: Weekly email updates to them.

title: Coordinate legal compliance check for analytics data retention
description: Coordinate with the legal team to clarify and ensure compliance regarding the analytics data retention policy.
evidence: Arun: Need to clarify analytics data retention policy. Jeffy: Compliance check with legal. Mira: I’ll coordinate.

title: Update onboarding help pages
description: Update existing user support help documentation relevant to the new onboarding process.
evidence: Mira: Regarding user support, is there a help doc update planned? Leah: Yes, updating onboarding help pages this week.
